column1: Apparently, the 15 countries outside the EU deemed epidemiologically 'safe' and residents allowed in to the EU to be announced this week will include:-Algeria, Australia, Canada, Japan, Montenegro, Morocco, New Zealand, Rwanda, Serbia, South Korea, Thailand, Tunisia, Uruguay, Georgia and China (but only if China reciprocates).The list will apparently be reviewed every 2 weeks by the EU.Source in spanish: https:/…1124717.htmlRe: cruise liner visits, it was reported yesterday that the Government of Spain will maintain the restriction of entry to Spain's ports until the 'end of the the crisis'. Apparently, exceptions may be made for 'specific liners'.Source in spanish: https:/…1124593.html

The official list (in multiple languages)...https://www.consilium.europa.eu/en/press/pre…The list is to be reviewed and updated every 2 weeks apparently.It's a recommendation and is therefore not legally binding. As far as the Government of Italy is concerned, quite understandably after the horrendous loss of lives they have had, Italy will be sticking to mandatory quarantine and health surveillance for any arrivals outside the Schengen area.If interested, you can read about that here in spanish: https://elpais.com/sociedad/2020-06-30/itali…

Updated list of third countries 16/07/2020.https://www.consilium.europa.eu/en/press/pre…In multiple languages.Just 13 countries left on the list following the removal of Serbia & Montenegro due to the spread of SARS-CoV-2 in those countries.As previously mentioned, it's a recommendation and isn't binding on any of the 27 EU countries.
